H0.text: Chemiosmosis is the process by which ions flow through ATP synthase from the thylakoid space into the stroma.

H1.text: Oxidation is the process by which ions flow through ATP synthase from the thylakoid space into the stroma.

H2.text: Respiration is the process by which ions flow through ATP synthase from the thylakoid space into the stroma.

H3.text: Fertilization is the process by which ions flow through ATP synthase from the thylakoid space into the stroma.

A4.text: Chemiosmosis is the movement of ions across a semipermeable membrane through an integral membrane protein, down their electrochemical gradient.

A5.text: The protons move back across the inner membrane through the enzyme ATP synthase.
